result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D Fisher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Fisher to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months. This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent.

superMiscConds.notes: --to pay statutory costs, $250 DNA surcharge plus $235 in subpoena fees

--no possession of any controlled substances or paraphernalia without a valid prescription

--no possession of any hypodermic needles unless prescribed by a doctor

--no presence at Pourman's Saloon

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent

--random drug screening

--to maintain absolute sobriety

--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency: JCSD

 If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per the Agent

[ma] Case called at 10:15am 
Defendant Matthew D Fisher appears via video conferencing from Milwaukee House of Corrections, in custody.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.

On Defendant's Petition for Sentence Adjustment:
--Statement made by Mr. Fisher
--Arguments given by ADA Shock, objects to petition

The Court denies Mr. Fisher's petition for sentence adjustment
recess: 10:25am
Order to Produce defendant - Sent Adjust - 08-13-19
Sentence adjustment review on August 13, 2019 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Reserve Judge Davis presiding for Branch IV: 
case caled at 8:54am.
Defendant Matthew D Fisher in court, in custody  with Attorney Jeffrey W Purnell.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Mr. Fisher, verifying that he understands and joins in the agreement.
Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Hall submits the victim restitution request documentation); the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Fisher guilty of Count #1, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2, #3, #4, #5.

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Fisher to  3  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18  months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent. 

The Court finds that Mr. Fisher is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Fisher is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision those conditions listed on the Criminal Case Settlement form, which are:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--random drug screening
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession of any controlled substances or paraphernalia without a valid prescription
--no possession of any hypodermic needles unless prescribed by a doctor
--no presence at Pourman's Saloon
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay statutory costs, $250 DNA surcharge plus $235 in subpoena fees 


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 9:17am
Sent to Defendant (1)NOH for 3/18/16 Plea/Sent Hrg//sent to LKA
to Produce & Transport the Defendant from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility on 3-18-16

Case called at 9:38 am [Clerk SH] (Final Status Scheduling Conference)
Defendant Matthew D Fisher appears via video, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey William Purnell. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds video is sight and sound sufficient
Atty Purnell informs the Court that they have an offer that they would like to accept. Were expecting to do today, but do not believe can via video. 
DA Happ: Do not believe can do by plea as well, do believe will need a writ. Request to cancel trial and set plea/sentencing date
Atty Purnell: Agreed, offer is for concurrent time, so would like to have Dodge County matter under way if possible. Request two weeks at least or 1st week in March.
Court cancels jury trial and sets matter for plea/sentencing - State to prepare writ
Atty Purnell informs the Court that if Mr. Fisher is moved he will contact the State/Court
Recess: 9:50 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing 3/18/16 at 8:45 am - Send notices

[MK] case called at 8:54am. 
Defendant Matthew D Fisher in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa and Attorney Jeff Purnell.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that Mr. Fisher is requesting the substitution of counsel to Attorney Purnell;  an adjournment of next week's trial next would be needed related to this.  
ADA Hall is not opposing the substitution.  ADA Hall indicates that the State is joining in the request for trial adjournment--this is needed because ADA Teuber has just returned from a medical leave today, and because the State's victim/witness has passed away and the State needs to evaluate how it will proceed; it is possible that the son of the victim/witness will be able to testify regarding non-consent.
The Court grants the Request fo Substitution of Counsel.  The Court adjourns and reschedules the Jury Trial.
The Court continues the Bond.
recess 9:01am 
[Post Hearing/Off Record Mr. Fisher verifies to the clerk that the 2133 S. 96th Street, West Allis WI address remains current.]

NEXT:    (1) FSSC on 2/9/16 at 9:00am   (2) Jury Trial on 2/15 and/or 2/16/16 at 8:30am (counsel estimate one day length is needed)

Case called at pm [Clerk SH] 
Defendant Matthew D Fisher in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa: No resolution as yet, still investigating. Requests additional 30 - 45 days for investigation so if Court prefers to set for trial requests to set in 60 - 75 days
ADA Shock requests matter be set for trial in suggested time frame
Counsel agree 2 days is needed for trial
Court informs Mr. Fisher that the FSSC is the last date to enter a plea in this matter and that his bond/conditions of bond remains in effect while case is pending
Recess: 2:20 pm 

NEXT:  (1) Schedule FSSC 11/9/15 at 9:00 am & JT 11/16-17/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices

Reserve Judge Hassin presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 9:50am. [MK]
Defendant Matthew D Fisher in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Fischer indicates that the W. Lincoln Avenue address is current. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel given. The Court refers Mr. Fisher to the PD Office. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--not to be in the Town of Sullivan for any reason
--no contact with Roberta Short or with the Town of Sullivan
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 9:56am.
reconvene 10:12am. 
Mr. Fisher indicates that the date of birth on the Criminal Complaint is incorrect:  the correct date is 09/05/1984.
On Motion of the State, the Court amends the Criminal Complaint to show 9/5/84 as the DOB.  
recess 10:13am.
